meanings.definition: Not safe or fit to sail on the sea.
meanings.sent1: The old, unseaworthy boat creaked in the rough waves.
meanings.sent2: The captain refused to take the unseaworthy vessel out to sea.
meanings.sent3: The unseaworthy ship looked like it might sink in a puddle!
meanings.sent4: Her argument was as unseaworthy as a paper boat in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The unseaworthy raft was a disaster waiting to happen.

meanings.definition: Not meeting the necessary standards for safe navigation at sea.
meanings.sent1: The unseaworthy ship had rusty navigation equipment.
meanings.sent2: The maritime authorities declared the vessel unseaworthy due to safety violations.
meanings.sent3: The unseaworthy yacht seemed to have a mind of its own, steering off course.
meanings.sent4: His excuses for being late were as unseaworthy as a leaky boat.
meanings.sent5: The unseaworthy compass led them astray in the open ocean.
